The gravitational force acting on the rod is mg.

When a current I_2 passes through the rod, the magnetic force is F_{B2} = I_2 L B, directed vertically upwards.

premise: Since I_2 > I_1, F_{B2} is greater than mg.
conclusion: The net force due to the magnetic force exceeds the weight of the rod, causing the springs to elongate.
Let the elongation of the springs be Δx.

conclusion: Using the previously obtained relation I_1 L B = mg, we can express the net force as: I_2 L B - I_1 L B = 2kΔx
Solving for Δx: Δx = (I_2 - I_1) L B / 2k
